data.title: Davis named MACCC Sports Information Director of the Year
data.meta_description: GULFPORT, Mississippi – Copiah-Lincoln Community College’s Natalie Davis was named Mississippi Association of Community College Conference Sports Information Director of the Year.
data.text:
GULFPORT, Mississippi – Copiah-Lincoln Community College's Natalie Davis was named Mississippi Association of Community College Conference Sports Information Director of the Year. It is the inaugural year for the award that is voted on by the state's sports information directors.

Davis, who has served as SID for 25 years, retired on June 30. She also served as the college's director of public relations and yearbook co-advisor.

A native of Savannah, Ga., Davis attended Wesleyan College (Georgia) and is a graduate of the University of Mississippi with a bachelor's degree in journalism.

Davis was a board member of the College Public Relations Association of Mississippi (CPRAM). She is also a member of the College Sports Communicators (CSC). Davis has served on the Brookhaven-Lincoln County Chamber of Commerce.

She was the recipient of the Eta Omega Chapter of Phi Theta Kappa's Faculty Scholar Award, Co-Lin's High Performance Award, and the Ann Bradberry Award. Davis was selected to Who's Who Among Junior College Instructors and has received numerous awards from the Mississippi Press Association, College Public Relations Association of Mississippi, and the National Council of Marketing and Public Relations.

She and her husband, Stephen, are the parents of two adult children, Leah Davis Glenn (John) and Paul Davis (Katie). They have three grandchildren, Sam and Hannah Glenn, Lily Kate Davis and another on the way.
